Articles.Content:
I heard that KSP-TV was coming out,but Instead of on twitch,why not on actual television?

Squad could set up a deal (Not guaranteed though.) with a tv network,then we can premiere some shows.

One question: Are you good at animating?

I was thinking for some titles (and some learning for kids stuff too!)

Education:

Bill & Bob Learning

Physics with Gene

Entertainment:

The A-Kerbs (Bill,bob,jeb)

Kirrim - Ultra Stuntkerb (yes danny2462)

Jeb's Mishaps (small stuff u know like 5 minute stuff u know)

You guys like this idea? (ONLY IF YOU LIKE IT, This isn't based on "this cant happen!" stuff,vote on the poll.)

And fans could donate to ksp to afford a tv show like this.
Kerbal Space Program is a video game. Video games don't get TV shows. Plus SQUAD wouldn't have nearly enough funding to pull it off.

Video games don't get TV shows.

You weren't around in the '80s, huh?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_television_programs_based_on_video_games
But it is called a video game. Not a game, a video game!

Kerbal Space Program is a video game. Video games don't get TV shows. Plus SQUAD wouldn't have nearly enough funding to pull it off.

Jimmy Neutron got quite a few video games. As did other cartoons.

This would cost a massive amount of money to do. Money that Squad doesn't have. Sorry, it's not really possible, nor would it be very useful for Squad.

But it is called a video game. Not a game, a video game!

Semantics.

Jimmy Neutron got quite a few video games. As did other cartoons.

Those were games based off of TV shows. Not TV shows based off of games. Not comparable.

Edited June 22, 2013 by bgraves
Super Mario Brothers' Super Show anyone?
maybe in the future... who knows?
I think it's unlikely to happen.

There is a difference between a show that becomes a game and a game that becomes a show. Also, KSP doesn't have enough STUFF for a TV show. What would you put on TV anyways? And they are off! heading into space on their newest and best rocket! The three brave astronauts you know and love shoot towards the sky. And Jebediah has crashed it again, will they successfully deploy their parachute? Find out next time!

KSP doesn't have enough STUFF for a TV show. What would you put on TV anyways?

There was a cartoon based on Pac-Man. It ran along with a cartoon based on RubikÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Cube. I would think those are somewhat less plot fodder than KSP.
SQUAD can do a TV Show... if you pay them $100,000 to produce and $250,000 to get someone to air it ;p

Kerbal Space Program is a video game. Video games don't get TV shows. Plus SQUAD wouldn't have nearly enough funding to pull it off.

Super Mario Bros Super Show, The Adventures of Sonic The Hedgehog, Halo tv series coming out soon
Sorry but this is a HIGHLY unrealistic idea. Its impossible.
KSP could do with some machinima's on youtube
This would be awesome , but it would be like the hungarian Viasat Science-Fiction : 0:00 Star Trek Enterpries 1:00 Stargate , so it would be hard to get good ideas for tv shows

Kerbal Space Program is a video game. Video games don't get TV shows. Plus SQUAD wouldn't have nearly enough funding to pull it off.

Wasn't the Halo TV series the only thing people were excited about when they revealed the XBOX one?

But anyway, for KSP, no. It doesn't have a big enough market and it's sandbox based, not story based.
Is this for real?
Granted, there have been video game shows in the past, but those were games that had an immense audience and funding.
Does nobody know about those little Kerbal shorts on Squad's YouTube Channel? Just watch this and tell me it didn't instantly make you want a Kerbal TV/Web show.
A web show with "Episodes" of 5 minutes is more possible

One of the visions for KSP-TV was exactly this. Create a show, be it a comedy, drama, whatever, and do it with kerbals in some kind of machinima. If someone or a team of people were to do this, I would definitely get it on the channel. Get a pilot done and PM me, we'll talk.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

The game doesn't have a big enough following and most likely never will. KSP is a niche product, it will never attract sales like a Mario or a Call of Duty. The general population are just too needy for instant gratification for a game like KSP to ever make it really big.

This would have been interesting some years ago, but now I think the internet is a better place for this kind of things. It's cheaper and easier, it can get to more people and it's more accessible. If you miss it you can watch it later. These are the reasons that have made contents on the Internet to grow while TV loses terrain.
What about commercials?
